across the land border from Lebanon into

called Syria

Cecelia I had a life-changing two weeks
there and the country and his people
haven't left my mind since the moment I
left now in the beautiful autumn palace
where the governor of Damascus used to
live Syria offers a complete package of
everything I enjoy about travel
delicious food fresh off the press
Australia
friendly people amazing hospitality
ancient wonders and beautiful nature in
this video I will share my thoughts
about Syria after I've had plenty of
time to gather them my nervousness
before entering Syria was on the same
level that I had before visiting
Afghanistan Yemen and North Korea I was
scared
plain and simple not only was it the
most difficult visa I've ever gotten but
it was extra risky to visit as a Jewish
American journalist 3no knows when it
comes to Syria but I managed to overcome
the adversities and proceed to having
one of the best trips of my life just
like all of my stories around the world
I decided to take an optimistic approach
while in Syria I thought to myself why
focus on the negatives when this country
has so many positive stories to tell I
thought that I was in a unique position
to share the good side of Syria so
that's exactly what I tried to do my
kids are so busy it's amazing to my
surprise in the weeks after my videos
were released there were dozens of
global news outlets and travelers
calling my trip propaganda for the
Syrian government I find these claims to
be absurd and hilarious to be honest so
I just want to make a few things clear
first of all my trip to Syria was not
sponsored by anyone except for my own
bank account and the case you guys are
wondering the trip costed me
approximately four thousand at US
dollars secondly Syria is a place that
I've long desired to visit even before
the war because I've been fascinated by
its culture and thirdly is there
anything wrong with traveling out of
pure curiosity to see life inside Syria
without getting political all right
putting my rant aside now that I've had
months to gather my thoughts I can
confidently say that Syria ranks in my
top 20 favorite countries in the world
it also ranks among the top 3 in the
categories of friendliness and
hospitality you think what is it what
water ok ok
time after time random Syrians that I
met on the streets were so generous like
the mosaic brothers who wouldn't take my
money because I was a visitor I had to
bring an extra suitcase home because of
all the unexpected gifts I received this
is not normal in other countries I've
only experienced this kind of
hospitality in a few other places like
Iran and Pakistan in terms of food I
found Syrian cuisine to be the best in
the Middle East and home to a few of the
tastiest dishes I've ever tried like
this stuff called food it's chickpeas
yogurt tahini and bread the markets are
bustling with fresh fruits vegetables
spices and sweets in fact the desserts
were so delicious that I made an entire
video dedicated to them my favorite
students with is a holistic in terms of
historical sites Syria is just about as
ancient as any place gets whether it's
enjoying the wonders of the old city of
Damascus witnessing the oldest Citadel
in the world in Aleppo right now we are
standing on top of Aleppo the highest
point here on the Citadel or seeing the
most well-preserved medieval castle just
outside of Homs I learned so much about
the history of our world the Toit's
build and beginning of the 11th century
on the flip side it's not responsible
with me to talk about Syria without
mentioning at the repercussions in terms
of safety you are not allowed to visit
the current areas of conflict so I
actually felt quite safe throughout
however there is no denying how
difficult it was to witness the
destruction in many parts of the country
it's horrific I've never seen so many
buildings in pieces and the fact that
it's all so recent makes it hit home a
lot harder
I think as the war hopefully calms down
the country will once again and be a
hotspot for tourism as it was just ten
years ago because let me tell you there
are a lot of hidden treasures inside
this country that have yet to be exposed
so the next time you think about Syria
try not to think about war and conflict
and try to remember the beauty that
exists within its borders I know that as
soon as time permits I'll be heading
back there to check out more and I hope
that you guys will give it a chance
thanks for watching guys stay safe and
I'll see you later
